DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Sample Normal Control Extracted DNA Quantification Method Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text that describes the quantification method of the normal control sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Sample Normal Control Extracted DNA Quantification Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI)_The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another._A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance._A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information._A concept referring to measurement of a unit._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation.

Property.preferredName: Normal Control Extract DNA Quantitation Method
Property.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI):The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance.:A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information. :A concept referring to measurement of a unit.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance.
A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.
The act of measuring or estimating a quantity.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
